who's here to share some resume tips but

and we'll create the content for you

loose you joined us today to share
resume tips so can you start by telling
us a little bit about what students
should include in their resume
when applying to an internship or a grad
role at aws
sure thanks for having me here today ali
it's really important for students to
invest
time into building a good resume because
your resume is
usually the first impression you give to
a potential employer
and it's what helps you progress to the
interview stage so when applying to an
internship or grad role at aws
always remember to tell your resume
based on the job description
instead of sending out a generic resume
every time you apply to something
regardless of the role though there's a
few sections that everyone should
include
and here's what i've included in my own
one i started off with my key contact
information
so email phone number and linkedin
profile
followed by an education section so what
i was studying at university
here you should also include your
predicted graduation month and year
because it makes it so much easier for
recruiters to see whether you're in your
penultimate year
final year or first few years of your
degree next i had a list of my
university and work experiences
so here i listed out my previous
internships and what student societies i
was a part of
and under each of these experiences i
had two or three dot points
just outlining what i did for each role
and what impact i was able to achieve
and finally i had a section with some of
my awards
followed by a skill section that
highlighted some of my technical skills
but please keep in mind that this is
just the structure i used my own resume
and depending on the job you're applying
for you might need to include more
sections
such as a list of your technical
projects if you're applying to a more
technical role
thanks luce i mean spending time on your
resume really does help you stand up
from the crowd
and lucy you mentioned that it's
important not to send out a generic
resume to every single job that you
might apply for
so do you have any tips for students
when it comes to tailoring their resume
for a specific job
so to tell your resume start by taking a
look at the job description
and highlight all the keywords that are
being used this will help you understand
what the job entails and what skills the
hiring manager is looking for
you know as a student even if you don't
have a lot of industry experience
chances are there's a lot of
transferable skills that you can bring
to the table
such as problem solving and working
effectively in a team
so don't list out every single
experience you've had but instead focus
on the ones that best align with the
skills mentioned on the job description
another way to tell your resume
especially if the job you're applying
for
is very different to all your other
previous experiences
is to add a short summary at the top of
the page to highlight the unique value
you can bring
and why you're applying to the position
this is completely optional but
and it really depends on what you prefer
that's some really great advice and will
definitely help you increase your
chances in landing the role that you
want so finally lose
what are some common mistakes that
students might make and that they should
actually avoid when creating their own
resume
so one mistake i see is students making
their resume a bit too long
there's not really a rule around this
but having more than two pages
is not really recommended for anyone
with less than five years of industry
experience
another mistake is not putting in enough
quantifiable metrics and action verbs to
show the impact they were able to
achieve
through each of their experiences and
one final mistake to avoid is having any
typos or grammatical errors
this one can be easily avoided by
getting a second pair of eyes to
proofread your resume
but overall don't spend too long trying
to perfect your resume
remember to also spend time improving
your interview skills and doing research
on the company and industry that you're
interested in
liz thank you so much for coming back on
